commit_message:
Upgrade pip/setuptools/wheel in role test venv

In the integrated build, the repo build process upgrades
pip/setuptools/wheel in the venv to our preferred pinned
version, but the role tests using developer mode does not.

Gnocchi, since 4.3.0 [1] requires setuptools > 30.3.0 -
but CentOS only has 28.8.0 when it builds the venv, so the
package install fails.

In this patch we create the venv, then upgrade pip,
setuptools and wheel, then install the keystone packages.

Doing this for all roles is impractical, but it will be
necessary to unblock patches from merging into this role
today. In the future when we use the python_venv_build role
we can do all this there instead of repeating this patch
across all the roles.

[1] https://github.com/gnocchixyz/gnocchi/commit/3f8a22a51bec3a60709bcbf26648c4fd6a66d2b8
Change-Id: Ibb5a068350b30f0d74ef26a55528527bd9e646a3

subject: Add retry to execution commands
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-09-11 17:56:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 15993, 'date': '2018-09-14 16:31:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-09-14 16:31:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-11 17:56:18.000000000', 'message': 'Add retry to execution commands

There are quite a few instances where the "exec_command" function fails
due unrelated issues. This change adds a retry with a backoff. The exec
function will now retry 3 times in the event of an exception with a cool
down of 2 seconds. The play context for retries will also be set if
undefined making it possible to recover from transient UNREACHABLE
errors.

Change-Id: Ic7c7af49e1c5eba21216b33814b92e276e3fba3e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 621c552e233473bca9ce220abe210025052c9ada)
'}]
commit_message:
Add retry to execution commands

There are quite a few instances where the "exec_command" function fails
due unrelated issues. This change adds a retry with a backoff. The exec
function will now retry 3 times in the event of an exception with a cool
down of 2 seconds. The play context for retries will also be set if
undefined making it possible to recover from transient UNREACHABLE
errors.

Change-Id: Ic7c7af49e1c5eba21216b33814b92e276e3fba3e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 621c552e233473bca9ce220abe210025052c9ada)

commit_message:
[doc] Open vSwitch: Remove auto_bridge_add support

We have two functionally identical places where we add bridges, one in
the neutron chart and one in the openvswitch chart.

It makes more sense to do it only in the neutron chart as that aligns
with the linux_bridge configuration and also is where the
bridge_mappings are specified.

Change-Id: Ia3ff1dd262ffaea64ff9a8380ca19b67af191428
Depends-on: xxx

I'm okay with this because in my evaluation this is not damaging to the existing tests for other components."}, {'account_id': 28935, 'date': '2018-09-14 01:32:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-09-14 04:02:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

FWIW, I did some tests with (container) acls. First, created some containers:

 $ export ST_AUTH=http://saio:8080/auth/v1.0 ST_USER=test:tester ST_KEY=testing
 $ swift post test2 -r test2
 $ swift post tester2 -r tester2
 $ swift post test2:tester2 -r test2:tester2
 $ swift post test:tester2 -r test:tester2

Prep my test user:

 $ export ST_USER=test2:tester2 ST_KEY=testing2
 $ export OS_STORAGE_URL=http://saio:8080/v1/AUTH_test

Succeeded:

 $ swift stat test2
 $ swift stat test2:tester2

Failed with 403:

 $ swift stat tester2
 $ swift stat test:tester2

...all of which seems to make sense to me -- the account name is just one of the groups to which the user belongs, although if you wanted to only grant access to *one specific user* you can drill down.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-09-14 04:04:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2018-09-14 13:33:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2018-09-14 15:54:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Just rebased. And it works well as expected.'}]

commit_message:
Add another user for s3api func tests

Previously we'd use two users, one admin and one unprivileged.

Ceph's s3-tests, however, assume that both users should have access to
create buckets. Further, there are different errors that may be returned
depending on whether you are the *bucket* owner or not when using
s3_acl. So now we've got:

  test:tester1  (admin)
  test:tester2  (also admin)
  test:tester3  (unprivileged)

Change-Id: I0b67c53de3bcadc2c656d86131fca5f2c3114f14

they have been disabled for > 2 years.

https://github.com/openstack/keystone/commit/05ec0328771ed22397853b9b7b07e6746cb8c33c'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2018-09-13 20:03:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I missed that I had done the disable, and then Lnace took over the default provider effort.  It should have been re-enabled as part of that effort.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-09-14 16:29:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

auth has been ported to flask.

commit_message:
s/placement-config-generator/config-generator/

Change [1] added support for tox -e genconfig via a configuration file
called placement-config-generator.conf. Since we're in the placement
project and only have one config generator, the placement- part is
redundant. In keeping with similar pieces (e.g. policy-generator.conf)
this patch renames the file and fixes references.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/601838/

Change-Id: I8ea9c00d26539feab141ada493bc825987046b3d

subject: Name arguments to _get_provider_ids_matching
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 1063, 'name': 'Ed Leafe', 'email': 'ed@leafe.com', 'username': 'ed-leafe'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 25625, 'name': 'Tetsuro Nakamura', 'email': 'tetsuro.nakamura.bc@hco.ntt.co.jp', 'username': 'tetsuro0907'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-09-07 20:15:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-09-07 20:20:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Note to reviewers: This was originally in Nova [1]. Chris, Tetsuro, Ed, and Matt were in favor; then Jay downvoted with, "I don't believe this results in any better readability at all."

To which I say: It doesn't? You don't find 

        res = rp_obj._get_provider_ids_matching(
            self.ctx, resources,
            forbidden_traits={trait_two.name: trait_two.id,
                              trait_three.name: trait_three.id},
            member_of=[[uuids.agg1]])

more readable than

        res = rp_obj._get_provider_ids_matching(
            self.ctx, resources, {},
            {trait_two.name: trait_two.id,
             trait_three.name: trait_three.id}, member_of=[[uuids.agg1]])

? Do you find it *less* readable, or would you be okay letting it go through if others are still positive on it?

@Matt, do you find this to improve readability as you expected when you asked for it?

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/597291/'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-09-08 01:08:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I find this much more readable. In general, with a method signature that has more that 2 or 3 parameters, named arguments is much less fragile than ordered arguments.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-09-08 01:15:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Still don't think it's more readable."}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-09-08 15:34:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Well, strictly speaking, while I think this is an improvement, I would *NOT* touch `placement/objects/resource_provider.py` just for the readability of the test codes.

I would just specify the arguments' names explicitly in test codes not making them optional in the non-test codes, namely..."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-09-13 22:02:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-09-13 22:13:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

mehok'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-09-13 22:39:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

I still prefer explicit naming, but meh.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-09-14 16:21:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

This is milky toast, but sure why not, let's not leave this lying around."}]

commit_message:
Name arguments to _get_provider_ids_matching

In response to [1], and for readability, name the required_traits and
forbidden_traits arguments of _get_provider_ids_matching in their calls.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/591070/3/nova/tests/functional/api/openstack/placement/db/test_allocation_candidates.py@228

Change-Id: Ic80605359b2295d08dc337a55a810bf41ef69095

commit_message:
Resolve E004 File did not end with a newline

I have no idea why this is only showing up after a merge,
but it is doing so on stable/rocky patches in the linters
(bashate) test. This patch should resolve it.

Change-Id: Ib5e34b16c4bacc459883d2be8d503d9f1b22ea0d

Dumb question but are charm deployed pools not always exclusive? In which case should we not enable this feature at queens and not expose to end users?'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2018-09-11 19:44:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

By default our charms don't share pools but if ever someone decided to use them otherwise this would cause problems. I'm not hugely fussed either way."}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2018-09-11 20:06:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2018-09-11 22:14:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-05 13:56:52.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for rbd_exclusive_cinder_pool

If this is set to False (default=True) cinder will collect
information from Ceph about all volumes in the pool used
by this backend so that it has accurate information about
the capacity of the pool such that volumes not created by
or known to cinder may be included in capacity calculations
(i.e. cinder-scheduler). If the pool is only ever used by
Cinder (i.e. this backend) then it is not necessary to
collect this informtaion and this will speed up opertaions
such as deletes upon each of which cinder would normally be
collecting this information.

Change-Id: I5377e2886a6e206d30bd7dc38a7e43a085aa524c
Closes-Bug: 1789828
'}, {'created': '2018-09-05 13:57:55.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for rbd_exclusive_cinder_pool

If this is set to False (default=True) cinder will collect
information from Ceph about all volumes in the pool used
by this backend so that it has accurate information about
the capacity of the pool such that volumes not created by
or known to cinder may be included in capacity calculations
(i.e. cinder-scheduler). If the pool is only ever used by
Cinder (i.e. this backend) then it is not necessary to
collect this informtaion and this will speed up opertaions
such as deletes upon each of which cinder would normally be
collecting this information.

Change-Id: I5377e2886a6e206d30bd7dc38a7e43a085aa524c
Closes-Bug: 1789828
'}, {'created': '2018-09-05 14:42:49.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for rbd_exclusive_cinder_pool

If this is set to False (default=True) cinder will collect
information from Ceph about all volumes in the pool used
by this backend so that it has accurate information about
the capacity of the pool such that volumes not created by
or known to cinder may be included in capacity calculations
(i.e. cinder-scheduler). If the pool is only ever used by
Cinder (i.e. this backend) then it is not necessary to
collect this informtaion and this will speed up opertaions
such as deletes upon each of which cinder would normally be
collecting this information.

Change-Id: I5377e2886a6e206d30bd7dc38a7e43a085aa524c
Closes-Bug: 1789828
'}, {'created': '2018-09-05 16:21:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for rbd_exclusive_cinder_pool

If this is set to False (default=True) cinder will collect
information from Ceph about all volumes in the pool used
by this backend so that it has accurate information about
the capacity of the pool such that volumes not created by
or known to cinder may be included in capacity calculations
(i.e. cinder-scheduler). If the pool is only ever used by
Cinder (i.e. this backend) then it is not necessary to
collect this informtaion and this will speed up opertaions
such as deletes upon each of which cinder would normally be
collecting this information.

Change-Id: I5377e2886a6e206d30bd7dc38a7e43a085aa524c
Closes-Bug: 1789828
'}, {'created': '2018-09-11 20:06:38.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for rbd_exclusive_cinder_pool

As of the of the queens release cinder supports this config
option which, if enabled, stops cinder from query all
volumes in a pool every time it does a delete in order to
get accurate pool usage stats. The problem is that this
causes tons of non-fatal race conditions and slows down deletes
to the point where the rpc thread pool fills up blocking
further requests. Our charms do not configure pool by default
and we are not aware of anyone doing this in the field so
this patch enables this option by default.

Change-Id: I5377e2886a6e206d30bd7dc38a7e43a085aa524c
Closes-Bug: 1789828
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for rbd_exclusive_cinder_pool

As of the of the queens release cinder supports this config
option which, if enabled, stops cinder from query all
volumes in a pool every time it does a delete in order to
get accurate pool usage stats. The problem is that this
causes tons of non-fatal race conditions and slows down deletes
to the point where the rpc thread pool fills up blocking
further requests. Our charms do not configure pool by default
and we are not aware of anyone doing this in the field so
this patch enables this option by default.

Change-Id: I5377e2886a6e206d30bd7dc38a7e43a085aa524c
Closes-Bug: 1789828

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-27 08:29:21.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Add ceph-s3 test non-voting job

The complexity is from A) s3api not in the pipeline by default so that
the test requires in-process testing, B) in-process testing is confiugred
to be used in tox functest environment so we cannot kick start to just
run the swift clusert for testing purpose with custom in-process configurations.

So... this patch attempts to use saio setup for probe instead of in-process testing.
I'm currently not sure this works as expected. Perhaps, after s3api is in the
pipeline in default, we don't have to a lot of preparations this patch doing.

I know, the reason why we didn't set s3api by default is that
we should fix devstack to pass the functests even s3api by default.
So... if this doesn't work well, the next steps will be:

1. land s3api as optional
2. fix debstack
3. change s3api on by default
4. run ceph-s3api to the default existing Swift <- NEW task!

Maybe?

Change-Id: I6f30f74678ad35479da237361bee48c46c0ecc49

The complexity is from A) s3api not in the pipeline by default so that
the test requires in-process testing, B) in-process testing is confiugred
to be used in tox functest environment so we cannot kick start to just
run the swift clusert for testing purpose with custom in-process configurations.

So... this patch attempts to use saio setup for probe instead of in-process testing.
I'm currently not sure this works as expected. Perhaps, after s3api is in the
pipeline in default, we may not have to have a lot of preparations this patch doing.

Maybe?

Change-Id: I6f30f74678ad35479da237361bee48c46c0ecc49

via swiftstack/s3compat tool that shows the ratio of compatible S3 APIs

while migrating from swift3 into swift upstream repo so this is the porting of that.

custom gate jobs using keystone environment other than dsvm.

commit_message:
Add ceph-s3 test non-voting job

This patch added new non-voting gate job to check the s3api compatibility
via swiftstack/s3compat tool that shows the ratio of compatible S3 APIs
in the gate result for each patch. This is very useful to check the possibility
if the new incoming patch breaks S3 API compatibility unexpectedly.

Originally swift3 has this kind of the gate job but we missed the staff
while migrating from swift3 into swift upstream repo so this is the porting of that.

Note that currently the job is against to only tempauth because we don't have
custom gate jobs using keystone environment other than dsvm.

Change-Id: I6f30f74678ad35479da237361bee48c46c0ecc49

commit_message:
Fix container_backend issues on update

On updates/redeploys we seem to be getting the following error:
 "Error: /Stage[main]/Tripleo::Profile::Pacemaker::Rabbitmq_bundle/Pacemaker::Resource::Bundle[rabbitmq-bundle]/Pcmk_bundle[rabbitmq-bundle]: Could not evaluate: undefined method `container_backend\' for Pcmk_bundle[rabbitmq-bundle](provider=default):Puppet::Type::Pcmk_bundle::ProviderDefault", ',

Change-Id: I66cea4b582652c8407c4b36889684dd03b4d41c4
Closes-Bug: #1792571

commit_message:
Remove default_{host,port} deprecated options

The Kafka driver deprecated the kafka_default_host and
kafka_default_port options in 5.10.0, released in Ocata. Remove them.

Change-Id: I206e68ec1624bb6d5d6ba320572530352bbd4378

commit_message:
DNM: Revert eventlet back to 0.20.0

There's been a neutron test failure in one job since around
the time eventlet was bumped to 0.24.1, trying to figure
out if this was the cause.

Change-Id: I024d8e6232c7b9b8d02f18431b3924d3781525ee

commit_message:
DNM: Test with eventlet 0.20.0

The neutron-grenade-dvr-multinode job failure rate started
increasing on 9/7, try to see if eventlet bump had anything
to do with it.

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/601660/

Change-Id: I9905e3e1f7af0c293199ea2bc5013fd754091294

commit_message:
Use latests version of python-troveclient in tests

This patchset changes version of python-troveclient package version
used in tests.
So far, version from global constrain file was used [1].

In order to achive this, a local constrain file for tests requirements
has been added. This made it possible to override global constrain
versions.

[1] openstack/requirements/upper-constraints.txt

Change-Id: Ic4383f0249e5bd367461f63f66217af959aefba4
Signed-off-by: Marcin Piwowarczyk <m.piwowarczy@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Update and move test README.rst

The file was started, but not completed, for nova. This change updates
the document to:

* be more placement oriented
* fill in some of the blanks
* remove parts that are not relevant
* move it in placement/tests from placement/tests/unit

Change-Id: I4712dc4e22323ef5622d38e1dce1143c89a68f8d

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Id8307e8f54555af333984211caeaaee0ec2b5123
Story: #2002586
Task: #24288

have been migrated to the git repositories owned by the magnum team.

See the python3-first goal document for details:

the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'ssl' job, given that the person working on

commit_message:
Clean up role tests

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'ssl' job, given that the person working on
   that is no longer doing so, and no-one else has picked up
   the work.

Change-Id: I2aac4caa7b1d1eb32212b39a973a76681618c555

commit_message:
Replace port 35357 with 5000

Now that the v2.0 API has been removed, we don't have a reason to
include deployment instructions for two separate applications on
different ports.

commit_message:
Consolidate add/remove router interface OVS transactions

This patch consolidades the database transactions for creating/deleting
router ports on/from the OVN NB database. Having a single transaction is
ideal to avoid inconsistencies that can be cause between two or more
transactions.

Closes-Bug: #1756388
Change-Id: I0a0a5f6571ea695b91db89170be1fab258acd917

commit_message:
PoC: Support exclusive traits

This patch supports exclusive traits with "SPECIAL_" prefix to see
and discuss how the code and the performance would be if the spec
is approved.

Change-Id: Ie86f81bfc7fcfd42ede5a77cc57877ee008d03ec
Blueprint: bi-directional-traits

commit_message:
End project gating for fuxi projects

These projects are abandoned and will no longer be updated nor maintained,
so we'll retire it. This commit ends the project gating and will be
followed up by more commits removing the project content.

This commit affects:

- openstack/fuxi
- openstack/fuxi-golang
- openstack/fuxi-kubernetes

Announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-September/134546.html

Change-Id: I2efa5b08b0ff38cada99945371902add0f8748cd

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Idbdcc4c85e0764dca17c557b95c77dd9095a6484
Story: #2002586
Task: #24288

commit_message:
Filter out instances without a host when populating AZ

It could happen that instance does not have a host set, e.g.
when its creation failed before it was scheduled.
During online_migration, populate_missing_availability_zones tries to
add missing AZs to all instances. However for instances without a host
there's no reasonable value for AZ (we can't use a logic that bases
the value on a host) so let's skip this kind of instances completely.

Change-Id: Ic6060beaa08af5ea70e5e54fffb94eea58aa7bbf
Closes-Bug: #1788115
(cherry picked from commit 690f91b5c7f7e84a4e6d351b27c05818d947cce1)
(cherry picked from commit ad14e428f82f02d71e0b33ec6d20e7810a978e3b)

commit_message:
Add parameter for docker-registry image

Without this parameter defined in the service, we do not actually
pull the container during the container prepare. This leads to the
registry pod not actually deploying.

Change-Id: I09484b7325035fa719b63a295c4469a93a692ff3

commit_message:
Trivial: Fix unnecessary redundant code

While translating node_template, heat-translator first checks whether
the policy is derived from the policies 'tosca.policies.Scaling' or
'tosca.policies.Monitoring', If yes, then it adds them into
TOSCA_TO_HOT_TYPE map. In the subsequent code, it again checks for
those policies and if they are not present in TOSCA_TO_HOT_TYPE map
then it raises UnsupportedTypeError exception.

This patch removes this unnecessary redundant code of checking
policies again and ensures that the affected code is getting
covered through test case.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: Ibe435e23e7ac11834e662745d327e6f99280f9f5

I don't think python3-first changes the executable file name from python to python3. Would it imply to support all Zuul jobs on repositories with Python 3 like https://review.openstack.org/#/c/593876/1/.zuul.yaml ? 

Or please share more context on changing the executable file name - it would be great :)"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-09-06 19:36:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

> I don't think python3-first changes the executable file name from
 > python to python3. Would it imply to support all Zuul jobs on
 > repositories with Python 3 like https://review.openstack.org/#/c/593876/1/.zuul.yaml
 > ?
 > 
 > Or please share more context on changing the executable file name -
 > it would be great :)

To ensure that each script runs under python3, it is a good idea to use "python3" explicitly. 

You only need to add python 3.6 jobs if there are python unit test jobs for this repository.

This change looks good to me, thanks Frank!'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-09-08 18:05:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

There is no unit tests for these scripts.
I previously proposed to place them in importable path in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/448598/, but the effort was blocked by more broader discussion of the structure of i18n related repositories. I have no idea on how to move this forward as it is beyond my intention and I have no time to work on this.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-09-11 18:11:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-09-11 18:14:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Thanks for comments - LGTM

 > You only need to add python 3.6 jobs if there are python unit test

(1 comment)

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > There is no unit tests for these scripts.
 > I previously proposed to place them in importable path in
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/448598/, but the effort was
 > blocked by more broader discussion of the structure of i18n related
 > repositories. I have no idea on how to move this forward as it is
 > beyond my intention and I have no time to work on this.

Maybe a periodic job to test the scripts would be useful. On the other hand: zanata_userinfo.py requires admin credentials on Zanata API to fetch confidential user data. And I don't know which load these periodic runs would be produced on the Zanata server."}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-09-11 20:40:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-09-13 23:51:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-09-14 13:20:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Make subnodes and primary_node facts cacheable

For jobs that run separarate playbooks, the inventory is run
at different playbooks, subnode and primary_node have to be cacheable
to have those values defined

Testing patch https://review.openstack.org/602563

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/596887/

Change-Id: I190a1b2b3da081bbfe831057b5873813624d52e0
Closes-Bug: 1792440

commit_message:
Abstract container backend

In the future we want to be able to create bundles that can make
use of different container backends. We leave the current default
set to 'docker' but we allow other types.
Tested with the 'podman' backend after applying:
https://github.com/ClusterLabs/pacemaker/pull/1564
https://github.com/ClusterLabs/pcs/pull/181
https://github.com/ClusterLabs/resource-agents/pull/1193

Change-Id: Ia4a7b58d14d80e85d51e98acec1aad2ba90b69de

commit_message:
Disable +r on #openstack-infra

In order to test if the freenode spam attack is over set -rf on
openstack-infra over the weekend to see if we get any spam. If things
are quiet we can change the global setting.

Change-Id: I842b50e1d49b6f3523a59a3e296731eeda382afb

[{'created': '2018-09-05 20:52:45.000000000', 'message': 'Stop requiring users be registered on openstack channels

Freenode sustained a spam attack that forced us to require users be
registered on our channels. Recently we removed this requirement on
the #openstack-infra channel to see if the spam attacks have persisted.
Now a day later we have had no spam attacks.

Remove the +r (and related +f) modes from our channels to be more
friendly to users.

Change-Id: I10783a393765f14e6dc44be46b789b67fdbbc7f3
'}]
commit_message:
Stop requiring users be registered on openstack channels

Freenode sustained a spam attack that forced us to require users be
registered on our channels. Recently we removed this requirement on
the #openstack-infra channel to see if the spam attacks have persisted.
Now a day later we have had no spam attacks.

Remove the +r (and related +f) modes from our channels to be more
friendly to users.

Change-Id: I10783a393765f14e6dc44be46b789b67fdbbc7f3

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-10 15:36:58.000000000', 'message': "Set/unset external MAC addresses for NAT entry when port is up/down

When using distributed floating IPs, we set the external MAC
address and logical port fields regardless whether the LSP
is up. For the particular use of Octavia LB VIP, which doesn't
ever get bound, the floating IP associated to it will never
get the flows installed by ovn-controller.

This patch changes the mechanism so that the DNAT entries get
updated only on port up/down changes. If the port remains
down, the external_mac will be cleared and traffic to those
FIPs will still go through the centralized router.
When a port gets bound to a chassis, if DVR is enabled, the
mac_address field will be populated and traffic will go to
the compute node.

 Conflicts:
	networking_ovn/tests/unit/fakes.py

Closes-bug: #1789686
Change-Id: I0043984b4bb7b3780112aba170ffb956c48084d0
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit c44d075269acb0b28ef3d68071ac3864911077d9)
"}]
commit_message:
Set/unset external MAC addresses for NAT entry when port is up/down

When using distributed floating IPs, we set the external MAC
address and logical port fields regardless whether the LSP
is up. For the particular use of Octavia LB VIP, which doesn't
ever get bound, the floating IP associated to it will never
get the flows installed by ovn-controller.

This patch changes the mechanism so that the DNAT entries get
updated only on port up/down changes. If the port remains
down, the external_mac will be cleared and traffic to those
FIPs will still go through the centralized router.
When a port gets bound to a chassis, if DVR is enabled, the
mac_address field will be populated and traffic will go to
the compute node.

 Conflicts:
	networking_ovn/tests/unit/fakes.py

Closes-bug: #1789686
Change-Id: I0043984b4bb7b3780112aba170ffb956c48084d0
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit c44d075269acb0b28ef3d68071ac3864911077d9)

commit_message:
Prevent mistral-db-manage not found error

The mistral DB manage populate code was to work around a specific
issue on Ocata. The bug is now closed as invalid and the workaround
causes the overcloud-prep-images.sh script to fail when
step_root_device_size is enabled, so remove the mistral DB population
call. I haven't observed any issue after removing it.

Change-Id: I29ee156494c381591f06a62ca6259506730c0b61
Related-Bug: #1649350

commit_message:
Parallelize server pre and post steps

Update the play for the server pre and post steps so that the tasks run
in parallel across all roles, instead of doing one role at a time. By
not using the "when" attribute, and relying on the tripleo_role_name var
for the list of deployments, we can force these tasks to run in parallel
across all roles.

Change-Id: I83a4deaa68d5788edb5ab13652bb30c762f337d8

commit_message:
Check instance state before attach/detach interface

Currently there isn't any instance's status checking before
attach/detach interface, It will fail when some status didn't
support it. This patch add checking for it.

This patch allow attach/detach interface for ACTIVE, PAUSED
and STOPPED instance.

* ACTIVE: The interface is hotplug to instance.
* PAUSED: The interface can be hotpluged after instance unpaused.
It's fixed by commit: a868fcedf8e46070cae6aa8e59e61934fa23db1c
* STOPPED: In this status, the instance is destroyed. It just update
the instance configuration with new interface. When the start
instance, the instance will be recreated with new configuration.

Change-Id: I3c038056085be1f655758ed8b6a44bcdbf70cdd5
Closes-bug: #1299333

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: If4b648e3c31bad1b82a36bd07dd94dfbcfd2c713
Story: #2002586
Task: #24346

commit_message:
Add CLI option '--skip-sync' to skip time-sync on specified nodes

The option '--skip-sync' can be used with CLI commands 'time-sync'
and 'revert-resume'.

Change-Id: I44ab39de5a46756f1174f6832ab3ea0badc987dc

[{'created': '2018-09-12 23:09:12.000000000', 'message': "[placement] split gigantor SQL query, add logging

This patch modifies the code paths for the non-granular request group
allocation candidates processing. It removes the giant multi-join SQL
query and replaces it with multiple calls to
_get_providers_with_resource(), logging the number of matched providers
for each resource class requested and filter (on required traits,
forbidden traits and aggregate memebership).

Here are some examples of the debug output:

- A request for three resources with no aggregate or trait filters:

 found 7 providers with available 5 VCPU
 found 9 providers with available 1024 MEMORY_MB
 found 5 providers after filtering by previous result
 found 8 providers with available 1500 DISK_GB
 found 2 providers after filtering by previous result

- The same request, but with a required trait that nobody has, shorts
  out quickly:

 found 0 providers after applying required traits filter (['HW_CPU_X86_AVX2'])

- A request for one resource with aggregates and forbidden (but no
  required) traits:

 found 2 providers after applying aggregates filter ([['3ed8fb2f-4793-46ee-a55b-fdf42cb392ca']])
 found 1 providers after applying forbidden traits filter ([u'CUSTOM_TWO', u'CUSTOM_THREE'])
 found 3 providers with available 4 VCPU
 found 1 providers after applying initial aggregate and trait filters

Co-authored-by: Eric Fried <efried@us.ibm.com>
Closes-Bug: #1786519
Change-Id: If9ddb8a6d2f03392f3cc11136c4a0b026212b95b
(cherry picked from commit b5ab9f5acec172d16e46876f60ca338434483905)
"}]
commit_message:
[placement] split gigantor SQL query, add logging

This patch modifies the code paths for the non-granular request group
allocation candidates processing. It removes the giant multi-join SQL
query and replaces it with multiple calls to
_get_providers_with_resource(), logging the number of matched providers
for each resource class requested and filter (on required traits,
forbidden traits and aggregate memebership).

Here are some examples of the debug output:

- A request for three resources with no aggregate or trait filters:

 found 7 providers with available 5 VCPU
 found 9 providers with available 1024 MEMORY_MB
 found 5 providers after filtering by previous result
 found 8 providers with available 1500 DISK_GB
 found 2 providers after filtering by previous result

- The same request, but with a required trait that nobody has, shorts
  out quickly:

 found 0 providers after applying required traits filter (['HW_CPU_X86_AVX2'])

- A request for one resource with aggregates and forbidden (but no
  required) traits:

 found 2 providers after applying aggregates filter ([['3ed8fb2f-4793-46ee-a55b-fdf42cb392ca']])
 found 1 providers after applying forbidden traits filter ([u'CUSTOM_TWO', u'CUSTOM_THREE'])
 found 3 providers with available 4 VCPU
 found 1 providers after applying initial aggregate and trait filters

Co-authored-by: Eric Fried <efried@us.ibm.com>
Closes-Bug: #1786519
Change-Id: If9ddb8a6d2f03392f3cc11136c4a0b026212b95b
(cherry picked from commit b5ab9f5acec172d16e46876f60ca338434483905)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-06 13:30:40.000000000', 'message': 'placement: use simple code paths when possible

Somewhere in the past release, we started using extremely complex code
paths involving sharing providers, anchor providers, and nested resource
provider calculations when we absolutely don't need to do so.

There was a _has_provider_trees() function in the
nova/api/openstack/placement/objects/resource_provider.py file that used
to be used for top-level switching between a faster, simpler approach to
finding allocation candidates for a simple search of resources and
traits when no sharing providers and no nesting was used. That was
removed at some point and all code paths -- even for simple "get me
these amounts of these resources" when no trees or sharing providers are
present (which is the vast majority of OpenStack deployments) -- were
going through the complex tree-search-and-match queries and algorithms.

This patch changes that so that when there's a request for some
resources and there's no trees or sharing providers, we do the simple
code path. Hopefully this gets our performance for the simple, common
cases back to where we were pre-Rocky.

This change is a prerequisite for the following change which adds
debugging output to help diagnose which resource classes are running
out of inventory when GET /allocation_candidates returns 0 results.
That code is not possible without the changes here as they only
work if we can identify when a "simpler approach" is possible and
call that simpler code.

Related-Bug: #1786055
Partial-Bug: #1786519
Change-Id: I1fdbcdb7a1dd51e738924c8a30238237d7ac74e1
(cherry picked from commit 9ea340eb0d3bdb103bd64ca40b999bd2b10b80aa)
'}]
commit_message:
placement: use simple code paths when possible

Somewhere in the past release, we started using extremely complex code
paths involving sharing providers, anchor providers, and nested resource
provider calculations when we absolutely don't need to do so.

There was a _has_provider_trees() function in the
nova/api/openstack/placement/objects/resource_provider.py file that used
to be used for top-level switching between a faster, simpler approach to
finding allocation candidates for a simple search of resources and
traits when no sharing providers and no nesting was used. That was
removed at some point and all code paths -- even for simple "get me
these amounts of these resources" when no trees or sharing providers are
present (which is the vast majority of OpenStack deployments) -- were
going through the complex tree-search-and-match queries and algorithms.

This patch changes that so that when there's a request for some
resources and there's no trees or sharing providers, we do the simple
code path. Hopefully this gets our performance for the simple, common
cases back to where we were pre-Rocky.

This change is a prerequisite for the following change which adds
debugging output to help diagnose which resource classes are running
out of inventory when GET /allocation_candidates returns 0 results.
That code is not possible without the changes here as they only
work if we can identify when a "simpler approach" is possible and
call that simpler code.

Related-Bug: #1786055
Partial-Bug: #1786519
Change-Id: I1fdbcdb7a1dd51e738924c8a30238237d7ac74e1
(cherry picked from commit 9ea340eb0d3bdb103bd64ca40b999bd2b10b80aa)

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I1735c09327eb2dac52fb6c153ea05168f572395b
Story: #2002586
Task: #24308

subject: Fix how Mistral calculates workflow output
messages:
[{'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-09-13 10:22:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-09-13 10:29:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-09-13 12:23:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-09-13 13:43:55.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-09-13 13:44:10.000000000', 'content': 'Restored

Failing in the gate. So kicking out and restarting.'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-09-13 13:44:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-09-13 13:44:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-09-14 04:40:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-13 10:22:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fix how Mistral calculates workflow output

* Workflow output sometimes is not calculated correctly due to
  the race condition between different transactions: the one that
  checks workflow completion (i.e. calls "check_and_complete") and
  the one that processes action execution completion (i.e. calls
  "on_action_complete"). Calculating output sometimes was based on
  stale data cached by the SQLAlchemy session. To fix this, we just
  need to expire all objects in the session so that they are
  refreshed automatically if we read their state in order to make
  required calculations. See the bug description for more details
  on how the problem was observed.
* Added another test for direct workflow that formally checks
  calculation of workflow output. It doesn't pretend to test the
  aforementioned issue (it can be reproduced only with a big number
  of attempts, and/or under load). It's for the sake of the test
  module completeness.

Change-Id: I4a7e7fd9a4bbb6e93df169b4b40bc2d83ccfce89
Closes-Bug: #1792090
(cherry picked from commit dfdff78315f72999dbd269e5fc4c4065a1b13013)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix how Mistral calculates workflow output

* Workflow output sometimes is not calculated correctly due to
  the race condition between different transactions: the one that
  checks workflow completion (i.e. calls "check_and_complete") and
  the one that processes action execution completion (i.e. calls
  "on_action_complete"). Calculating output sometimes was based on
  stale data cached by the SQLAlchemy session. To fix this, we just
  need to expire all objects in the session so that they are
  refreshed automatically if we read their state in order to make
  required calculations. See the bug description for more details
  on how the problem was observed.
* Added another test for direct workflow that formally checks
  calculation of workflow output. It doesn't pretend to test the
  aforementioned issue (it can be reproduced only with a big number
  of attempts, and/or under load). It's for the sake of the test
  module completeness.

Change-Id: I4a7e7fd9a4bbb6e93df169b4b40bc2d83ccfce89
Closes-Bug: #1792090
(cherry picked from commit dfdff78315f72999dbd269e5fc4c4065a1b13013)

commit_message:
Expose nova.conf config lines to be used as hiera overrides

Included nova::config in undercloud puppet-stack-config
puppet manifest so that nova configuration parameters can
be overriden using hiera overrides.

Change-Id: I71bc5ed35cc41139481ceb51216183e6c703cf01

subject: Hard to read README from github because of wrong format

commit_message:
Fix .zuul.yaml

* Remove "queue: heat" from check queue, this is not needed.
* Use openstack-lower-constraints-jobs template.
* Remove templates that stay in project-config
  (periodic-jobs-with-oslo-master, install-guide-jobs,
  release-openstack-server) since they only run on master - or specific
  branches.

Change-Id: I2b4a49ff025499aff8d05b8e293a2a17c48f5cec

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-05 20:13:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix test_run_workflow unittests

The test_run_workflow unittests occasionally fail because one the call
args is a string representation of a dictionary and the order of its
keys could be different than that of the string representation of the
expected dictionary.

This ordering problem is fixed by turning the actual call argument into
a json object then dumping it as a string sorted by key.  The expected
dictionary is also dumped into a string sorted by key.  Then both sorted
values are compared.

Change-Id: I4b3cb5f713694f8667050fc7d5d54cfb597d216a
(cherry picked from commit bb66cc1e41c76058d6f47c126e2931805d30806f)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix test_run_workflow unittests

The test_run_workflow unittests occasionally fail because one the call
args is a string representation of a dictionary and the order of its
keys could be different than that of the string representation of the
expected dictionary.

This ordering problem is fixed by turning the actual call argument into
a json object then dumping it as a string sorted by key.  The expected
dictionary is also dumped into a string sorted by key.  Then both sorted
values are compared.

Change-Id: I4b3cb5f713694f8667050fc7d5d54cfb597d216a
(cherry picked from commit bb66cc1e41c76058d6f47c126e2931805d30806f)

commit_message:
Validate member address for batch update members

We added the configuration option for reserved IP addresses that cannot
be used for load balancer member addresses, but the validation for
batch update members is missing.

This patch should also be backported to stable branches.

Change-Id: Ibd3145cfd8b92a494f7cceff10414d6e153136e9
Story: 2003413

It seem that if driver name is None nova try to set
rx_queue_size tx_queue_size config. (they define the
virtio-net rx/tx queue sizes). Direct/Physical Direct
vnic_types are not vritio so this kind of config is
invalid and causing booting guest to failed. To avoid
issues we skip such configuration these  vnic_types

Closes-Bug: #1789074

Change-Id: I45532896690ad9505f2b09c98d8d86b61bcfef2b
(cherry picked from commit 622ebf2fab0a9bf75ee12437bef28f60e083f849)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: skip setting rx/tx queue sizes for not virto interfaces

It seem that if driver name is None nova try to set
rx_queue_size tx_queue_size config. (they define the
virtio-net rx/tx queue sizes). Direct/Physical Direct
vnic_types are not vritio so this kind of config is
invalid and causing booting guest to failed. To avoid
issues we skip such configuration these  vnic_types

Closes-Bug: #1789074

Change-Id: I45532896690ad9505f2b09c98d8d86b61bcfef2b
(cherry picked from commit 622ebf2fab0a9bf75ee12437bef28f60e083f849)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-05 17:13:02.000000000', 'message': 'l2 pop: check for more than 1 first active port on a node

With high concurrency more than 1 port may be activated on an
OVS agent at the same time (like VM port + a DVR port),
so the patch mitigates the condition by checking for 1 or 2
first active ports.

Given that the condition also contains "or self.agent_restarted(context)"
which makes it True first 180 sec (by default) after agent restart,
I believe the downside of changing 1 to 2 should be negligible.

Please see bug for more details on the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1789846
Change-Id: Ieab0186cbe05185d47bbf5a31141563cf923f66f
(cherry picked from commit b32db30874a7729c4e9209cfc18e106a7e9fc697)
'}]
commit_message:
l2 pop: check for more than 1 first active port on a node

With high concurrency more than 1 port may be activated on an
OVS agent at the same time (like VM port + a DVR port),
so the patch mitigates the condition by checking for 1 or 2
first active ports.

Given that the condition also contains "or self.agent_restarted(context)"
which makes it True first 180 sec (by default) after agent restart,
I believe the downside of changing 1 to 2 should be negligible.

Please see bug for more details on the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1789846
Change-Id: Ieab0186cbe05185d47bbf5a31141563cf923f66f
(cherry picked from commit b32db30874a7729c4e9209cfc18e106a7e9fc697)

[{'created': '2018-09-10 23:25:03.000000000', 'message': 'Rename py35 v3 only check

This renames the "keystone-dsvm-py35-functional-v3-only" check to
"keystone-dsvm-py35-functional-federation" in order to better
describe what this job does. This also removes the
"ENABLE_IDENTITY_V2=FALSE" setting since v2 has since been removed
from keystone.

Change-Id: If6c4a5844eb1d2f9f75c614634c781c2915c4a11
'}]
commit_message:
Rename py35 v3 only check

This renames the "keystone-dsvm-py35-functional-v3-only" check to
"keystone-dsvm-py35-functional-federation" in order to better
describe what this job does. This also removes the
"ENABLE_IDENTITY_V2=FALSE" setting since v2 has since been removed
from keystone.

Change-Id: If6c4a5844eb1d2f9f75c614634c781c2915c4a11

'}]
commit_message:
Update Zuul configuration

Couple of cleanups:
* Use openstack-lower-constraints-jobs template instead of
  individual jobs.
* The repo has both openstack-python36-jobs and extra cinder-tox-py36
  jobs, remove the cinder specific ones in benefit of the global one.
* Replace job cinder-tox-functional-py36 with
  openstack-tox-functional-py36.
* Separate job lines with empty line for better readability.
* Remove extra branches lines, those are wrong - each branch has its own
  .zuul.yaml file.

Change-Id: I6897cd0bb2386d31b8b17355cd88d9b42cf98fac

commit_message:
Add a chunks_finished to BaseDiskFileWriter

BaseDiskFileWriter will track md5 and expose upload_size, etag via the
chunks_finished method.

The BaseDiskFileReader already tracks the md5/etag via _iter_etag, for
parity we add a _chunks_etag to the BaseDiskFileReader.

Instead of returning the upload_size and hexdigest every call to write,
we return the tuple from chunks_finished.

Change-Id: I26c58719cff5fde941d0248c250a0204e0379ae5

messages:
[{'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-08-14 15:17:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-08-14 15:18:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

I just want to see if we can backport the change without the RPC bit, because I don't think we need signaling to the source machine about the configuration of the destination. So, I just stripped that part out for this test patch, for discussion at least."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-08-14 18:58:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yeah, so without the RPC changes and forcing the wait to be enabled, we're getting the events properly with the default live migration job configuration at least:

http://logs.openstack.org/75/591775/2/check/nova-live-migration/a60168a/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#_Aug_14_18_28_12_158342

So, personally I think it's probably worth backporting this to replace the functionality we're removing with the revert of the libvirt-specific thing."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-08-15 01:40:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I just want to see if we can backport the change without the RPC bit, because I don't think we need signaling to the source machine about the configuration of the destination. So, I just stripped that part out for this test patch, for discussion at least.

Kind of wish this wouldn't be coming up now, because originally when working on this change I wrote the config option to be backward compatible so we could backport that change, but over time and review people (including myself?) thought that since the vif plugged event is based on the networking backend on the destination host, but the event is received on the source host, that we need the RPC changes in order to signal from the dest to the source whether or not it should wait for the event. That was also because on master we were supporting changing vif types during live migration, so OVS->LB and vice-versa, and we know some networking backends (ODL) don't send the network-vif-plugged event for vif plugging (only for port host binding), which is why it was written the way it was, which is admittedly complicated to handle that type of scenario - and the help text on the option is itself complicated for that caveat. Before rocky, we only support live migration between hosts with the same networking backend, e.g. OVS->OVS. So if we assume that, and the option is just set globally, then the backport is probably OK as long as it's disabled by default to not wait. I just wish it had come up way earlier."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-08-15 13:29:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Kind of wish this wouldn't be coming up now, because originally
 > when working on this change I wrote the config option to be
 > backward compatible so we could backport that change, but over time
 > and review people (including myself?) thought that since the vif
 > plugged event is based on the networking backend on the destination
 > host, but the event is received on the source host, that we need
 > the RPC changes in order to signal from the dest to the source
 > whether or not it should wait for the event. That was also because
 > on master we were supporting changing vif types during live
 > migration, so OVS->LB and vice-versa, and we know some networking
 > backends (ODL) don't send the network-vif-plugged event for vif
 > plugging (only for port host binding), which is why it was written
 > the way it was, which is admittedly complicated to handle that type
 > of scenario - and the help text on the option is itself complicated
 > for that caveat. Before rocky, we only support live migration
 > between hosts with the same networking backend, e.g. OVS->OVS. So
 > if we assume that, and the option is just set globally, then the
 > backport is probably OK as long as it's disabled by default to not
 > wait. I just wish it had come up way earlier.

Okay, well, I guess all I can do is apologize for not reviewing the original change.

I think I would have still argued that if you have mixed ODL and other backend types that we could push the responsibility on the operator to use aggregates to keep like things together. Obviously it's nice if it "just works", but it also kinda sucks to make one end ignore its setting to wait for a notification just because the other end doesn't do it.

Anyway, I think it's probably worth backporting the thing without the RPC, left disabled by default, and just make the point that the older releases can't do cross-type migrations and that this doesn't work for ODL (at least).

I'll try to get this cleaned up a bit more and propose some of that verbiage. Should I keep the reno here and augment it with queens/pike-specific wording, or create another one and drop this one?'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-08-15 13:57:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Anyway, I think it's probably worth backporting the thing without the RPC, 
> left disabled by default, and just make the point that the older releases 
> can't do cross-type migrations and that this doesn't work for ODL (at 
> least).

I'm OK with the backport, yes.

> I'll try to get this cleaned up a bit more and propose some of that 
> verbiage. Should I keep the reno here and augment it with queens/pike-
> specific wording, or create another one and drop this one?

I think the reno is mostly OK, just remove the parts about this being read on the dest host, the rest of it still applies."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-08-15 14:27:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-08-15 15:25:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-08-15 16:04:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2018-08-16 08:55:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-08-17 16:46:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

i have tested the master verions of this cherry-pick with live_migration_wait_for_vif_plug=true on centos 7.5 with linux bridge, ovs with iptables(hybrid plug true) and ovs with ovs firewall( hybrid plug false) neutron backends and it appears to work as intended.

i think this is safe to backport however i have not varifed the stable/queens branch myself.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-08-21 18:04:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 28885, 'date': '2018-08-22 04:29:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2018-08-22 12:17:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: -Code-Review

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-14 15:17:25.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Wait for network-vif-plugged before starting live migration

This adds a new config option which is read on the destination host
during pre_live_migration and the value is returned back to the
source host, which can be used to determine, from the source host,
if it should wait for a "network-vif-plugged" event due to VIFs
being plugged on the destination host. This helps us to
avoid the guest transfer at all if vif plugging failed on the dest
host, which we just wouldn't find out until post live migration
and then we have to rollback.

The option is disabled by default for backward compatibility and
also because certain networking backends, like OpenDaylight, are
known to not send network-vif-plugged events unless the port host
binding information changes, which for live migration doesn't happen
until after the guest is transferred to the destination host.

We could arguably avoid the changes to the live migrate data
versioned object and just assume the same networking backend is
used within each cell, but this does allow the deployer to have
the flexibility of live migrating between different network
backends (eventually anyway). The ability to live migrate between
different VIF types is being worked on as part of blueprint
neutron-new-port-binding-api.

Related to blueprint neutron-new-port-binding-api

 Conflicts:
	nova/conf/compute.py
	nova/tests/unit/objects/test_migrate_data.py

Change-Id: I0f3ab6604d8b79bdb75cf67571e359cfecc039d8
(cherry picked from commit 5aadff75c3ac4f2019838600df6580481a96db0f)

commit_message:
Wait for network-vif-plugged before starting live migration

This adds a new config option which is read on the source host
during pre_live_migration which can be used to determine
if it should wait for a "network-vif-plugged" event due to VIFs
being plugged on the destination host. This helps us to
avoid the guest transfer at all if vif plugging failed on the dest
host, which we just wouldn't find out until post live migration
and then we have to rollback.

The option is disabled by default for backward compatibility and
also because certain networking backends, like OpenDaylight, are
known to not send network-vif-plugged events unless the port host
binding information changes, which for live migration doesn't happen
until after the guest is transferred to the destination host.

Related to blueprint neutron-new-port-binding-api
Related-Bug: #1786346

NOTE(danms): Stable-only changes to this patch from master include
removing the RPC-related communication from the destination
to the source node. As such, the new option is read on the source
node so the conf option help and release note are updated. This is
OK before Rocky since we don't claim support to live migrate
between different networking backends (vif types), so operators
would need to set the option universally, or at least have host
aggregates in place if they are using different network types.

Conflicts:
        nova/conf/compute.py
        nova/tests/unit/objects/test_migrate_data.py

Change-Id: I0f3ab6604d8b79bdb75cf67571e359cfecc039d8
(cherry picked from commit 5aadff75c3ac4f2019838600df6580481a96db0f)

commit_message:
Ceilometer meters for ODL should use project id of admin

OpenDaylight v2 driver should set project_id as the uuid of the
tenant owning the port for port meters and admin tenant id for switch,
switch.port and table meters. The admin tenant id should be fetched from
keystone.

Change-Id: I728770c058604d786d2e59addc6793a9c0e8e0d8
Signed-off-by: Deepthi V V <deepthi.v.v@ericsson.com>
(cherry picked from commit f5140781a374d3dc7a2a1715d91b908c513e383a)

commit_message:
Remove deprecated rabbit options

Remove the deprecated options rabbit_host, rabbit_port, rabbit_hosts,
rabbit_userid, rabbit_password, rabbit_virtual_host and
rabbit_max_retries which were deprecated in 5.10.0, released during
Ocata.

Change-Id: I39dec568e5de0b653e5af1f196537e09ef126a36
Closes-Bug: #1712394

commit_message:
Begin the 'T' Release naming process

We're approaching the time when it'd be good to know what the T release
will be.  Personally I'd like to finalise the election dates for the T
cycle.

I'm happy to coordinate this.  The nomination period is a little longer
than most as I'm going to be in PTO for most of that month.  I figured
giving things a little longer wont hurt but I'm also happy to let other
handle this if they want.

Change-Id: I3fff48c3b72608aaa14d18c65a0aa339c2f9362d

commit_message:
Add debug info to devstack to capture NAT related details.

The purpose of this patch is to periodically dump the NAT entries
and related lflows in a way that it will help us debug bug
1735154.

Change-Id: I9d3af7708bf43b2be1c3c99ec6e385b7277b01b4
Related-Bug: 1735154

commit_message:
Add release uuid to pods and rc objects

This PS adds the ability to attach a release uuid to pods and rc
objects as desired. A follow up ps will add the ability to add arbitary
annotations to the same objects.

Depends-On: Iceedba457a03387f6fc44eb763a00fd57f9d84a5
Change-Id: I324680f10263c1aefca2be9056e70d0ff22fcaf0
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

is enabled.

Change-Id: Ib33181943d90278e1e1e9498bb0d77fd6c029ce5
'}, {'created': '2018-09-13 21:54:00.000000000', 'message': 'Change default SRIOV exclude_devices to ""

The current default for exclude_devices is null, which will
render suboptimally when using secret-based configmaps.
This changes it to "" (empty string) which will render correctly
when SRIOV is enabled.

Change-Id: Ib33181943d90278e1e1e9498bb0d77fd6c029ce5
'}]
commit_message:
Change default SRIOV exclude_devices to ""

The current default for exclude_devices is null, which will
render suboptimally when using secret-based configmaps.
This changes it to "" (empty string) which will render correctly
when SRIOV is enabled.

Change-Id: Ib33181943d90278e1e1e9498bb0d77fd6c029ce5

commit_message:
use the new puppet-nova parameter for sync_power_state_interval

Use the new sync_power_state_interval parameter from puppet-nova to
avoid any breakage in the future, like Puppet resource duplication
error.

Depends-On: Ie82d88f16b42d4405853153460e20f38ba42714a
Change-Id: Ia2cff1c5f4bee28ff1d2b513f2d0b061ab0bbe83
(cherry picked from commit 8dcb08a4ec376faa6a8702c644cfe1ae82a6cf47)

Hmm, so why not just only apply this to Ocata then? Any reason to even do this in Pike/Queens?"}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-08-09 16:46:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> > This looks OK but isn't used until we go as far back as Ocata. So
 > > this is going to need to be backported to Pike and Ocata too.
 > 
 > Hmm, so why not just only apply this to Ocata then? Any reason to
 > even do this in Pike/Queens?

I think the rationale was that the code exists in pike and queens, so even though it is dead, it's there, and patching only ocata would create a gap where ocata is different (from a visual code inspection perspective) than pike and queens.

I thought the fix should go to ocata only, since the code is dead from pike onward, but didn't feel super strongly about it."}, {'account_id': 26286, 'date': '2018-08-10 02:07:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> > This looks OK but isn't used until we go as far back as Ocata. So
 > > this is going to need to be backported to Pike and Ocata too.
 > 
 > Hmm, so why not just only apply this to Ocata then? Any reason to
 > even do this in Pike/Queens?

As discussed in this patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570653 ,  we need to start the bugfix on queens and then bring it back to Ocata."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2018-09-13 21:15:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Cherry Picked

> https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570653/ is already abandoned on
 > stable/ocata so there's no need for this to land on Queens and Pike

commit_message:
[Stable Only] Remove soft-deleted instances from quota_usages

The resources in quota_usages table will minus 1 while
soft deleting an instance. But the soft-deleted instances
are counted when synchronizing quota_usages using command
"nova-manage project quota_usage_refresh". So we filter
out soft-deleted instances when synchronizing quota_usage.

We didn't need to do this on master as the quota_usage_refresh
command has been removed in 17.0.0 (Queens). And the
_instance_data_get_for_user function is already removed
in commit c881e77819f1b8ca48c0dfd0ebfb75daaabf1033.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570865/

Change-Id: I8dcbe1e5f3f70ddd7067fed1125ef3379044ab0f
Closes-bug: #1773542

commit_message:
Validate member address for lb graph creation

We added the configuration option for reserved IP addresses that cannot
be used for load balancer member addresses, but the validation for lb
graph creation is missing.

This patch should also be backported to stable branches.

Change-Id: I5ba30d29e7a35b370f21d9f68ec43efed74dd363
Story: 2003413
Task: 24555
(cherry picked from commit 809915c4b17286209135a81d6c3c49f92d76a0e9)

commit_message:
Add release uuid to pods and rc objects

This PS adds the ability to attach a release uuid to pods and rc
objects as desired. A follow up ps will add the ability to add arbitary
annotations to the same objects.

Change-Id: Iceedba457a03387f6fc44eb763a00fd57f9d84a5
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

Change-Id: I796942c59d9c8031a0c67261eecd3498d9ef8af8
'}, {'created': '2018-08-16 16:09:14.000000000', 'message': 'Drop nose dependencies

Horizon test setting no longer depends on nose and related stuffs.
This commit cleans up nose related dependencies.

The change was made in horizon Rocky-3,
so horizon 14.0.0.0b3 is required at least.

Also drops unnecessary Django dependencies. There is no need to
install Django explicitly as it is a horizon dependency.
Babel is dropped from the same reason.

Change-Id: I796942c59d9c8031a0c67261eecd3498d9ef8af8
'}]
commit_message:
Drop nose dependencies

Horizon test setting no longer depends on nose and related stuffs.
This commit cleans up nose related dependencies.

The change was made in horizon Rocky-3,
so horizon 14.0.0.0b3 is required at least.

Also drops unnecessary Django dependencies. There is no need to
install Django explicitly as it is a horizon dependency.
Babel is dropped from the same reason.

Change-Id: I796942c59d9c8031a0c67261eecd3498d9ef8af8

commit_message:
Move Sahara test playbook into role

The Sahara playbook/vars are not used by any other
role, so we move them into the sahara role to allow
changes to be made to it without requiring an extra
repo change.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/583428
Change-Id: Iad7bd929102a20c6a1620a12f217a6b040ba955c

commit_message:
Ceilometer meters for ODL should use project id of admin

OpenDaylight v2 driver should set project_id as the uuid of the
tenant owning the port for port meters and admin tenant id for switch,
switch.port and table meters. The admin tenant id should be fetched from
keystone.

Change-Id: I728770c058604d786d2e59addc6793a9c0e8e0d8
Signed-off-by: Deepthi V V <deepthi.v.v@ericsson.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-04 18:18:04.000000000', 'message': "Make scheduler.utils.setup_instance_group query all cells

To check affinity and anti-affinity policies for scheduling instances,
we use the RequestSpec.instance_group.hosts field to check the hosts
that have group members on them. Access of the 'hosts' field calls
InstanceGroup.get_hosts during a lazy-load and get_hosts does a query
for all instances that are members of the group and returns their hosts
after removing duplicates. The InstanceList query isn't targeting any
cells, so it will return [] in a multi-cell environment in both the
instance create case and the instance move case. In the move case, we
do have a cell-targeted RequestContext when setup_instance_group is
called *but* the RequestSpec.instance_group object is queried early in
compute/api before we're targeted to a cell, so a call of
RequestSpec.instance_group.get_hosts() will result in [] still, even
for move operations.

This makes setup_instance_group query all cells for instances that are
members of the instance group if the RequestContext is untargeted, else
it queries the targeted cell for the instances.

Closes-Bug: #1746863

Change-Id: Ia5f5a0d75953b1154a8de3e1eaa15f8042e32d77
(cherry picked from commit a2e994e0526b79772375ea81ce8d63eb81412ce6)
"}, {'created': '2018-09-05 16:33:29.000000000', 'message': "Make scheduler.utils.setup_instance_group query all cells

instance create case and the instance move case. In the move case, we
do have a cell-targeted RequestContext when setup_instance_group is
called *but* the RequestSpec.instance_group object is queried early in
compute/api before we're targeted to a cell, so a call of
RequestSpec.instance_group.get_hosts() will result in [] still, even
for move operations.

This makes setup_instance_group query all cells for instances that are
members of the instance group if the RequestContext is untargeted, else
it queries the targeted cell for the instances.

Closes-Bug: #1746863

Change-Id: Ia5f5a0d75953b1154a8de3e1eaa15f8042e32d77
(cherry picked from commit 14f4c502f92b10b669044e5069ac3b3555a42ee0)

commit_message:
Make scheduler.utils.setup_instance_group query all cells

To check affinity and anti-affinity policies for scheduling instances,
we use the RequestSpec.instance_group.hosts field to check the hosts
that have group members on them. Access of the 'hosts' field calls
InstanceGroup.get_hosts during a lazy-load and get_hosts does a query
for all instances that are members of the group and returns their hosts
after removing duplicates. The InstanceList query isn't targeting any
cells, so it will return [] in a multi-cell environment in both the
instance create case and the instance move case. In the move case, we
do have a cell-targeted RequestContext when setup_instance_group is
called *but* the RequestSpec.instance_group object is queried early in
compute/api before we're targeted to a cell, so a call of
RequestSpec.instance_group.get_hosts() will result in [] still, even
for move operations.

This makes setup_instance_group query all cells for instances that are
members of the instance group if the RequestContext is untargeted, else
it queries the targeted cell for the instances.

Closes-Bug: #1746863

Change-Id: Ia5f5a0d75953b1154a8de3e1eaa15f8042e32d77
(cherry picked from commit 14f4c502f92b10b669044e5069ac3b3555a42ee0)

commit_message:
Set upper bound on max-complexity in pep8

The current max-complexity in placement code is 17, so set the
upper bound in the pep8 tests to max of 18 so we get an error
when we're going to make it worse. The current high complexity
(but still under 18) functions are:

./placement/util.py:415:1: C901 'parse_qs_request_groups' is too complex (17)
./placement/objects/resource_provider.py:1341:1: C901 'ResourceProviderList._get_all_by_filters_from_db' is too complex (16)
./placement/objects/resource_provider.py:2848:1: C901 '_get_provider_ids_matching' is too complex (16)

commit_message:
Simplify zuul.yaml

This relies on inheritence to reduce the parameters of the jobs
and make sure things are easier to read.

Change-Id: If95e82202551612dc4ff9f1411c32e34399f51dd
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

subject: Update the HACKING.rst file
messages:
[{'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-09-13 22:04:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-09-13 22:18:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-09-13 22:19:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

I think it is fine for these changes to be incremental as long as we keep at them, so happy to +2 if there's gonna be more later, but some thoughts before I do:

* I'm not sure I'm fully understanding what "not on the critical path" is meaning. What is the end goal of the critical path and which path do you mean? We do need the docs to be right at some point. If the path you mean is the one leading placement self-governance, the need for a proper and working openstack-placement is orthogonal to that. But openstack-placement and reasonable docs are aligned.

* For the section that lists the [N###] rules: those are enforced by nova/hacking/checks.py which we did not bring in to placement. Placement's hacking rules are the defaults from flake8 plus the ones added by the base 'hacking' module (of which there are many, try taking 'hacking' out of test-requirements.txt and do a tox -r -epep8, totally different set of rules).

Given that, it is probably reasonable for HACKING.rst to be more generic and not include the specifics section, except (potentially) in the form of generic advice on good behavor, such as:

* please don't use that weird whitespace driven alignment thing that makes diffs so pernicious

(which we can't enforce outright because of existing code)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-09-13 22:20:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-09-13 22:45:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-09-13 22:49:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Yeah, this is less misleading, but we'll definitely want to do more later."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-09-13 23:00:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Cool'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-13 22:04:23.000000000', 'message': 'Update the HACKING.rst file

I started working on this to remove any vestigial Nova-isms, but in
discussions at the PTG we concluded that doc work is not on the critical
path for extraction. So I added a NOTE at the point where I had stopped
so that it can be resumed later, and so that anyone reading this
document would understand that it is a WIP.

Change-Id: I14cb451a11c680ecca1a43154ecc9d5b9174ab01
'}, {'created': '2018-09-13 22:45:24.000000000', 'message': 'Update the HACKING.rst file

Since the hacking.py file was omitted from the history extraction, it is
felt that it would be best to start the hacking rules from scratch and
build this file (and a new hacking.py) as we need. A NOTE has been added
to clearly mark this file as a WIP for anyone who reads it.

Change-Id: I14cb451a11c680ecca1a43154ecc9d5b9174ab01
'}]
commit_message:
Update the HACKING.rst file

Since the hacking.py file was omitted from the history extraction, it is
felt that it would be best to start the hacking rules from scratch and
build this file (and a new hacking.py) as we need. A NOTE has been added
to clearly mark this file as a WIP for anyone who reads it.

Change-Id: I14cb451a11c680ecca1a43154ecc9d5b9174ab01

[{'created': '2018-02-02 19:56:55.000000000', 'message': 'Add bond-network-templates for OVB public bond CI

te-broker can set up an OVB stack to deploy the overcloud
with public bond network isolation but the heat templates
used in the overcloud deployment were missing.

This review adds these templates from openstack-virtual-baremetal
so that public bond network isolation can be tested in CI.

Change-Id: Ied543e70491ff85d6fab4371812bca802c6b1032
'}]
commit_message:
Add bond-network-templates for OVB public bond CI

te-broker can set up an OVB stack to deploy the overcloud
with public bond network isolation but the heat templates
used in the overcloud deployment were missing.

This review adds these templates from openstack-virtual-baremetal
so that public bond network isolation can be tested in CI.

Change-Id: Ied543e70491ff85d6fab4371812bca802c6b1032

commit_message:
Fix batch update members

When batch update members request only contains existing members
update, octavia-api raises exception because 'pool_id' is missing.

This patch should backport to stable branches.

Change-Id: I43a9af83a6615d3bffb7ec9c69f8d0b66c03fc97
Story: 2003608
Task: 24940

commit_message:
Refix disk size during live migration with disk over-commit

Currently available disk of targer host is calculated based on
local_gb, not available disk(free_disk_gb). This check can be
negative if the target host has no free disk.

Change-Id: Iec50269ef31dfe090f0cd4db95a37909661bd910
closes-bug: 1744079

commit_message:
Stop supporting eventlet < 0.22.0

Eventlet changed signature of HttpProtocol.__init__() method in
version 0.22.
Neutron supported both versions: before 0.22 and 0.22 and newer
in neutron.agent.linux.utils.UnixDomainHttpProtocol

Now as eventlet was bumped up to 0.24.0 in upper-constraints [1]
it is not necessary to support older versions.
This patch removes support for eventlet < 0.22 in
neutron.agent.linux.utils.UnixDomainHttpProtocol

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/589382/

Change-Id: I396bf97308e07249cf3864a273c6eda57613e7b3
Closes-Bug: #1791178
